Text: Oh right, the son who \n left home to make his \n way in the world.
Like father like son, \n I guess.
Thank you, dearie! We \n never could've reunited \n without your help.

I'll work hard and find 
 a way to pay you back 
 for everything you've 
 done for me.
So don't you worry about \n your future, consider it \n taken care of.
Well good luck with \n all that!
I'm so-so *sniff* Aww, \n now I'm crying.
*Sniff* Now look at you, \n you made me cry.
I'm thinking the son \n might be the only normal \n one in the family...

I think my eyes are 
 starting to burn too... 
 Better get going before 
 the waterworks open.

I knew he'd be happy 
 to see what became of 
 his boy when he got 
 home...

But he got so inspired 
 that he made up his fool 
 mind to go out into the 
 world and prove himself.
Your Pa won't believe \n how far you've come.
We didn't exactly part \n on the best terms...
Thank you so much for \n helping me find him.
You're the little dearie \n who reunited me with my \n son, aren't you?
You two take care of \n each other now!
But I'll make it up to \n him, and you.
What!?
I can't complain... \n There are worse husbands \n and sons out there.
But... Pa left home.
Men can be such \n thick-headed fools \n sometimes, you know-
It's nice to have a good \n surprise here and there.
Guess this world still \n has some surprises for \n an old woman like me.
That's a nice picture, \n dearie. Look at my son \n with his fancy shop...
Very well, thank you. I \n never thought a person \n could change so much.
How have you two been \n getting along?
Pardon me, dearie, do \n you know where the place \n in this picture is?
Sorry, I'm new here. \n I just got into town \n a little while ago.
Oh, you'll find it for \n me? Thank you so much!

Wa- What? Uh... Okay, 
 I'll do my best. Do you 
 have an address I can 
 use?
Listen to this! My boy \n leaves home without \n saying a word...

Then the first letter he 
 sends after all this 
 time says he opened a 
 new store.

But my boy has always 
 been a little dim, he 
 forgot to write the 
 address.

And he was also always 
 the type to jump the 
 gun. Reminds me of 
 someone...

You know, after he was 
 born, he resembled my 
 dad a bit, but as he's 
 grown-

Oh yes, all very 
 interesting! I better 
 head off and find 
 that store!
Phew, thought I was \n about to get dragged \n down memory lane...
Find the Place in the Picture
I better ask if anyone knows where this shop is.
Take a Family Picture
That way, huh?
Right in front of me, you say?
Thanks anyway...
Over that way? Thanks.
Maybe I can ask around about the crane.
This is the crane from the back of the picture.
By the size of the crane, I should be able to find the store.
I can't find it anywhere...
I guess I'd better ask around.
Perfect!
Hmm, not so great a picture...
Where could it be?
It's probably not this way...
The crane's over there.
I can't seem to find it.
Old Woman: \n Boy's always been such a handful. *grumble* *grumble*
Find the Crane from the Picture
Find the Spot in the Picture \n Based on the Crane
Ask About the Store
I think this is the crane that's off in the distance.
Based on the crane in the photo, I think it's on another island.
I think I'm getting warm now, time to ask around.
Old Woman: \n Where are you going?
Old Woman: \n Weren't you going to take our picture?
Take a Picture of the \n Old Woman and Her Son

Can't say I know the 
 place, but you see that 
 giant crane in the 
 background?
Oh yeah! Maybe I can \n use that to help me \n find the place.

Can't say I know the 
 place, but you see that 
 giant crane in the 
 background?
Oh yeah! Maybe I can \n use that to help me \n find the place.
I don't know the store, \n but I recognise that big \n crane in the background.
Oh, right! I could use \n that crane to help find \n the store.
Hm? The crane in the \n picture is right \n over there.
Oh, yeah, it's right \n there! Thanks!
This must be the place!
Welcome to my shop, \n have a look around \n if you like.
Oh, I'm not a customer.
I was just looking for \n you and this store.
Just wait here, \n I'll be right back!
W-Wait, why were you \n looking for me!? Young \n people nowadays...
You darned fool! \n You don't write, \n you don't visit...

Now I hear you've 
 managed to make a life 
 for yourself with this 
 wonderful store. *sniff*
Sorry Ma, I know I \n was a handful when \n I was younger.

That's why I had to 
 strike out on my own and 
 prove I could make 
 something of myself.
I worked on some mining \n boats to earn the cash I \n needed to get started...

Before I knew it, all 
 this time had passed. 
 I'm sorry to make you 
 worry.

You should be sorry... 
 If only you'd have 
 written earlier, your Pa 
 could've... *sniff*
Pa? No...
Your Pa went far, far \n away just two days \n before your letter came.
Pa... NOOOO!
How terrible...
He left me all alone...
And went off on a \n pleasure cruise to visit \n the gravity storms.
Pa's alive! AWWW, you \n were yanking my chain.
I never said he \n was dead!
There you go, jumping \n the gun again... Some \n things never change.
I'm glad I don't \n have his mother...
Hey, how about I take a \n picture of you two?
Just stand there \n together in front \n of the store.
